title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 June 2015 - XWiki

11:18 <gdelhumeau> Denis1: are you working on XWIKI-12165?  
11:18 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:20 <gdelhumeau> I'm going to release 7.1.1 as soon as possible because a regression have been fixed  
11:20 <gdelhumeau> tell me when you have finished  
11:21 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:23 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <mflorea> Denis, quick question: does $services.security.authorization.hasAccess('admin', $spaceReference) work as expected? I.e. is it enough to check for admin on the space ref or do I need to pass the reference to the preferences page corresponding to that space?  
11:30 <tmortagne> mflorea: it's enough  
11:30 <tmortagne> otherwise it could not know if you want to check space right or preferences page right  
11:31 <tmortagne> the whole point in the new right system is to associate right to the actual entity they are associated to  
11:31 <tmortagne> while it was a mess in the old API where you had to know right system internals to know which document to ask for wiki level rigths  
11:44 <mflorea> tmortagne: great, thanks a lot!  
11:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki

12:29 <tmortagne> evalica: you forgot to move 7.1 branch to 7.1.1-SNAPSHOT  
12:29 <evalica> hmmm …. isn't this supposed to be handle by the release script?  
12:33 <tmortagne> evalica: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HUpdatetheparentversionandversionproperties  
12:35 <gdelhumeau> I'll do it  
12:38 <evalica> tmortagne:  I found the doc I've missed - thanks for notice  
12:38 <evalica> gdelhumeau: I'll do it - now that I know it was my mistake  
13:13 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:14 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <gdelhumeau> anybody knows if http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-7.1.x/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/18/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui/EditObjectsTest/testPropertyDisplayersForNewObjects/ is a flicker?  
13:28 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki70 you say "The Solr index changed so it needs to be recreated in case some new feature would expect to find the new fields". Is it done automatically? Should I do it from the wiki administration ? Or should I delete the solr data from the server?  
13:33 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you have to delete the whole folder when the change is in the schema since the schema setup is in the solr folder  
13:34 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I don't remember adding that node  
13:34 <gdelhumeau> maybe Enygma` then?  
13:34 <mflorea> but in general, what you have to do is to delete the solr folder from XWiki's permanent directory  
13:34 <mflorea> it is created automatically upon restart  
13:35 <mflorea> and the wiki is reindexed automatically too  
13:35 <mflorea> so the only thing you have to do is to delete data/solr  
13:35 <gdelhumeau> ok  
13:36 <lucaa> has quit  
13:41 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: no, I don`t remember adding that note either :)  
13:42 <Enygma`> re http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-7.1.x/org.xwiki.enterprise%24xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/18/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui/EditObjectsTest/testPropertyDisplayersForNewObjects/ indeed, it seems to be a flicker that surfaces once every 3-4 builds... have a look at #14 http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-7.1.x/org.xwiki.enterprise%24xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/14/ and at #11 http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-7.1.x/org  
13:43 <Enygma`> probably an issue with the DatePicker PO

17:13 <eromano> has joined #xwiki  
17:13 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:13 <lucaa> has quit  
17:13 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
17:15 <eromano> Hi again. Is anyone here familiar with the LDAP group cache? I'm having trouble with ldap group-to-xwiki group mappings.  
17:15 <eromano> Also thanks in advance. You guys have been really helpful in answering my questions.  
17:18 <tmortagne> eromano: what is you question about LDAP group cache ?  
17:19 <eromano> tmortagne: thanks for the quick reply - is there a delay between changing the cfg file for the group mappings and when that mapping takes place? I kept ldap group sync to always for sync on every login.  
17:19 <eromano> The problem is that upon logging in, it doesn't look like a user it being added to their mapped group. LDAP side of things looks okay (its a static group)  
17:19 <tmortagne> eromano: when you modify the cfg file you have to restart for it to be take into account anyway  
17:20 <eromano> Yeah, I did that.  
17:20 <eromano> Oh. Duh. That means the cache definitely clears. Hmm.  
17:20 <tmortagne> the cache is a memory cache so when you restart it's reseted  
17:20 <tmortagne> (it would have been stored or somethin but not here)  
17:20 <tmortagne> s/could/could/  
17:21 <tmortagne> s/would/could/  
17:21 <eromano> If a group mapping fails for whatever reason, would it be in the log somewhere?  
17:23 <tmortagne> eromano: I don't think so, but you would get it in the LDAP debug log  
17:23 <tmortagne> (as in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HEnableLDAPdebuglog)  
17:34 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:38 <eromano> Hmmm. I enabled all the LDAP components log levels to trace, and I see the authentication when I log in, but nothing on the group assignment.  
17:39 <eromano> Oh wait, I take that back.  
17:40 <eromano> Groupmapping found [XWiki.XWikiMHWiki\_Sensitive] [[cn=MHWiki\_Sensitive,o=redacted.redacted.com]]  
17:40 <eromano> Yet, the user doesn't appear in the group list.  
17:45 <tmortagne> eromano: this log is not about the group members, it's just printing the mapping from the configuration  
17:45 <tmortagne> note that the group members resolve will only be done the first time, then it will be take from the cache  
17:45 <tmortagne> so you need to get the log for the very first auth
